Science Village provides a place for professional botanists to perform their research and to interact with the large community of members, volunteers, general public, and staff that composes Fairchild Tropical Botanic Garden. This team of scientists includes Fairchild researchers, Florida International University faculty, post-doctoral fellows, graduate students , and laboratory volunteers. Administrative Staff Rose Ricks: Science Village Assistant Email: rricks@fairchildgarden.org Phone: 305-667-1651 x 3520 Researchers Carl E. Lewis, PhD : Director of Fairchild Tropical Botanic Garden Email: clewis@fairchildgarden.org Phone: 305-667-1651 x 3333 Systematics, molecular phylogenetics, micropropagation, orchids, palms Brett Jestrow, PhD : Herbarium Curator Email: bjestrow@fairchildgarden.org Phone: 305-667-1651 x 3427 Systematics, molecular phylogenetics, micromorphology and anatomy, plant exploration, Caribbean plants Jason Downing, PhD: Orchid Biologist Email: jdowning@fairchildgarden.org Email: jdown003@fiu.edu Phone: 305-667-1651 x 3354 Plant micropropagation, conservation ecology, molecular systematics, mycorrhiza, genetic diversity Jennifer Possley, MS : Field Biologist Email: jpossley@fairchildgarden.org Phone: 305-667-1651 x 3514 Natural areas management, ferns, restoration ecology, GIS, invasive species, threatened species Jimmy Lange, BS : Field Biologist Email: jlange@fairchildgarden.org Phone: 305-667-1651 x 3515 Conservation ecology, impacts of sea level rise on plant communities of south Florida, restoration ecology, field botany, GIS mapping of rare plants and habitats Kenneth J. Feeley, PhD: Ecology and biogeography of tropical forests, effect of climatic change in tropical forest structure, empirical modeling techniques Hong Liu, PhD : Associate Professor at Florida International University, Department of Earth and the Environment Email: hliu@fiu.edu Phone: 305-667-1651 x 3517 Orchid conservation, population biology, plant-animal interactions, reproductive biology, invasive species, China plants, restoration ecology Get Tickets Tickets Membership Fairchild Hours & Admission Events APP Contact Contact Us Media Inquiries In the News Blog FAQ Location 10901 Old Cutler Road Miami, Florida 33156 Garden Map ▸

The NightGarden About Food Vendors Getting Here Buy Tickets Inhabitants FAQ Press Contact More AT FAIRCHILD TROPICAL BOTANIC GARDEN Returning Nov 2019 A KILBURN LIVE PRODUCTION CONGRATULATIONS to the winner of The Lost Fairy Puzzle and the $2500 grand prize! As a team, Katrina T, Nicole C, and Bryan H were the fastest to submit the final correct answer and figure out the First Principle of the NightGarden: "It is through a youthful heart and mind that one unlocks the true magic within the NightGarden." â The Solution to the two-part puzzle can be found here . Stay tuned for more sights and challenges next year! When the sun sets, the NightGarden comes to life... About This holiday season, a world of enchantment comes to Fairchild Tropical Botanic Garden. Come step inside the magical NightGarden, where the Tree of Wisdom talks, fairies fly before your eyes, and dandelions are 10 ft tall. Take this unbelievable journey with the whole family and watch magic unfold. The enchantment starts November 23, 2018 and ends January 11, 2019.* “Forget about the Museum of Ice Cream—head straight to the NightGarden at Miami's Fairchild Gardens!” - Vogue â “The NightGarden has all the makings of a Miami hit.” - TimeOut Miami â "You'll be taking a lot of photos at The NightGarden... Your instagram account will never be the same." - Miami.com â *NightGarden is closed on 11/26, 27; 12/1, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 24, 27, 29; 1/7, 8 What to Expect Walk though Miami’s most gorgeous Garden at night and find it brought to life with stunning illumination, spectacular special effects, and unbelievable surprises for the whole family. Come suspend reality for a few hours and enjoy enchanted activities, such as talking to the wise tree, discovering the fairies' hidden message, and trying your luck with our not-so-simple scavenger hunt. We have also invited some of Miami’s top-rated eateries to elevate this experience with first rate food and drink options. Food Vendors Getting Here Location Fairchild Tropical Botanic Garden 10901 Old Cutler Road Miami, FL 33156 Parking Directions Opening Hours November 23, 2018 - January 11, 2019* Sunday - Thursday 6:00 PM - 10:00 PM Friday - Saturday  6:00 PM - 11:00 PM *NightGarden is closed on 11/26, 27; 12/1, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 24, 27, 29; 1/7, 8 Get your tickets today! Buy Tickets Contact Us Questions? Check out our FAQ first. For anything else, email us at or call (305) 482-1148 between 12pm-9pm EST (M-F). Please Note: The NightGarden is only open at night and because it is an outdoor area immersed in nature it can be dark in some areas. Neither NightGarden nor Fairchild Gardens will be liable for any harm or injury to any person at the Fairchild Gardens, nor for any loss or damage to any belongings or property. Each guests enters the premises at their own risk. Furthermore guests are strictly prohibited from climbing on any trees, destroying any plant or pathway, touching any of the video activations, or disrupting other guests experience and may be asked to leave by management if found doing any of the foregoing. © 2018 by The NightGarden LLC. Privacy Policy

Shop Plants & Tropical Fruit Garden Shop Rare Plant Auction Get Tickets Shop Plants & Tropical Fruit Rare Plant Auction Become a Member Get Tickets My Account Educators Professional Development Fairchild’s professional development courses are uniquely designed for K-12 educators to increase their knowledge and understanding of the importance of plants, plant uses, and conservation efforts for the future. All Teacher Workshops are offered for Master Plan Point through MDCPS Frontline PD portal. If you are NOT an MDCPS teacher, please reach out to Fairchild Education directly to register at education@fairchildgarden.org RESEARCH IN THE CLASSROOM for 3rd through 12th Grade Educators October 18, 2025 8:30 am – 3:30 pm Transform your classroom into a dynamic hub of discovery with Research in the Classroom Teacher Professional Development, where you’ll learn to guide your students through authentic scientific inquiry that mirrors real-world research practices. This engaging workshop will empower you to seamlessly integrate rigorous research methodologies into your curriculum and take your students from initial curiosity to presentation-ready projects. You’ll master practical skills, including effective literature searching, sound experimental design, and creating pathways for your students to share their findings.  Join us to unlock your students’ potential as genuine researchers and give them the tools to investigate questions that matter to them and their communities. To register: MDCPS Teachers – CLICK HERE to register through Frontline All others, please email us at education@fairchildgarden.org Educator workshops made possible with the support of Latin American and Carribean Center ACC's US Department of Education Title VI Grant. Annually, we offer research grants for graduate students who are studying Tropical Biology. For more information and current due dates please contact the program administrator at apadolf@fairhcildgarden.org . Funds are limited and preference is given to Fairchild Graduate Fellows and students associated with Fairchild. Other Opportunities: Our graduate students also have received research support from some of the programs listed below: FIU – Tinker Grant Program in association with the Latin American and Caribbean Center and the School of International and Public Affairs Interdisciplinary Research Groups of FIU and UM to examine Latin American and Caribbean-related issues The Garden Club of America – Scholarships and Fellowships Florida Native Plant Society Fellowships for Graduate Environmental Study , Science to Achieve Results (STAR) program – Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Doctoral Dissertation Improvement Grants in the Directorate for Biological Sciences, (DDIG) – National Science Foundation (NSF) Endowment Fund – The International Palm Society Botanical Society of America Award Opportunities Fulbright Program Opportunities for American Students – U.S. Department of State Get Tickets Tickets Membership Fairchild Hours & Admission Events APP Contact Contact Us Media Inquiries In the News Blog FAQ Location 10901 Old Cutler Road Miami, Florida 33156 Garden Map ▸

Shop Plants & Tropical Fruit Garden Shop Rare Plant Auction Get Tickets Shop Plants & Tropical Fruit Rare Plant Auction Become a Member Get Tickets My Account Group Programs Spend an afternoon at Fairchild with a group of friends or colleagues. Our group tours provide a unique South Florida experience and may include a Tram Tour, a Guided Walk, and a boxed or buffet-style lunch, additional charges apply. For information or to make a reservation, call Visitor Services and Guest Relations at 305.667.1651, ext. 3328, or email visitorservices@fairchildgarden.org . Reservations are required at least two weeks in advance. Group Rates are for groups of 20 or more. Rates are $25 per person, or $18 per person for groups of 20 guests or more.. Your group escort and bus driver (if applicable) receive free admission. Lunch is available for an additional cost at The Glasshouse Cafe by Le Basque at 305.669.1070 or 786.973.2898. It is recommended to pre-purchase lunch in advance of your arrival. Group Visits During Festivals Please note that Tram Tours may be suspended during events or festivals to ensure the safety of our guests. For information or to make reservations, call Visitor Services and Guest Relations at 305.667.1651, ext. 3388, or email visitorservices@fairchildgarden.org . Group Tours are for groups of 20 or more. The group admission rate is $18 per person. Reservations are required. We ask that you make arrangements for your visit at least two weeks in advance of your visit. The group escort and bus driver (if applicable) receive free admission. School Year Field Trips For additional information or to schedule a field trip, please visit our field trip page by clicking HERE or send an email education@fairchildgarden.org . Reservations are required at least two weeks in advance and are on a first come, first served basis. Programs run Monday – Friday from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. October through May. Bag lunches are welcome. Private Tours Enhance your experience  in the Garden by taking an exclusive Private Tour! Whether you’re new to Fairchild or a longtime Member, these informative docent-led tours are offered throughout the day and are available for individuals or small groups of up to seven guests in the comfort of our shuttle carts; larger groups are accommodated in our trams. Guests enjoy the Garden’s sprawling 83 acres for approximately 1 ½ hours with our expertly trained and friendly volunteer docents. Afterward, explore the Garden at your leisure. Lunch is available for an additional cost at The Glasshouse Cafe by Le Basque at 305.669.1070 or 786.973.2898. It is recommended to pre-purchase lunch in advance of your arrival. To provide your party with the best experience, we recommend booking your private tour at least 2 weeks prior to your visit. We cannot accommodate day-of bookings. Private Tour Pricing (includes Garden admission, Garden exhibits, Wings of the Tropics exhibit, special exhibits, and a Private Tour lasting approximately 1 ½ hours). Groups of up to five guests: $250 Groups of up to seven guests: $300 Groups of more than seven guests:  $500 (limit 20 guests) additional guests $24.95 per person Member Pricing (groups of up to seven guests): $200 Get Tickets Tickets Membership Fairchild Hours & Admission Events APP Contact Contact Us Media Inquiries In the News Blog FAQ Location 10901 Old Cutler Road Miami, Florida 33156 Garden Map ▸

Shop Plants & Tropical Fruit Garden Shop Rare Plant Auction Get Tickets Shop Plants & Tropical Fruit Rare Plant Auction Become a Member Get Tickets My Account Membership As a valued Fairchild Member, you are joining a community that makes an indelible difference not just in South Florida but throughout the world. Your membership directly supports the beauty and science at Fairchild, science education and the best cultural programs, and events. Fairchild Members make what we do at the Garden possible. You’re joining one of the world’s preeminent botanical gardens, the home of the only K-12 botany magnet programs anywhere in the world and the largest student and citizen science outreach programs anywhere. Membership Benefits FREE daytime admission for ONE YEAR to 83 acres of gardens and exhibits. Access to our FREE selection of interactive tours, including guided tram tours and walking tours, and interactive programming. Discounts on tickets to premium daytime and evening events, concerts, lectures, our dynamic balance of classes, seminars, online plant sales, and more. Access to members-only previews for events and exhibitions (when available). Early morning Garden access on Tuesdays at 7:00 a.m. (at the South Entrance) Reciprocal benefits at participating gardens and arboreta. (Exclusions apply. Check visiting institution for restrictions/exclusions.) 100% tax deductible. (Certain restrictions apply for Sustaining and Signature levels) Membership Categories Customize your membership by choosing the category for your lifestyle. Each membership includes the benefits listed above. Click here to view our Membership Categories or scroll down to see each level. Individual Membership $105 (one year), $200 (two years) Membership is for One Adult Join or ReneW aS AN Individual MEMBER Now Dual Membership $130 (one year), $250 (two years) Membership is for Two Adults Join or Renew as a Dual Member Now Grandparents Membership $140 (one year), $270 (two years) Membership is for Two Adults and up to Five Grandchildren (16 years and younger) Price reflects discounted priced. Cannot be combined with senior discount. To join or renew or for more information, please contact Mary Neustein at 305-667-1651. ext. 3378 or email mneustein@fairchildgarden.org Join or Renew as a Fairchild Fellow Now Convert Your Admission to Membership Enjoy Fairchild every day by applying the price of your admission toward an annual membership to Fairchild on the day of your visit. Any of our friendly admission personnel can assist you during your visit or call the membership office at 305-667-1651, extension 3373 for more information. Offer expires 30 days after your visit. Give a Gift of Membership Share the wonders and beauty that Fairchild offers with a gift membership for a family, friend, or colleague. Choose from the many options and categories available. Opening the doors to our botanic garden offers gives a South Florida treasure as well as the opportunity to explore, explain and conserve the world of tropical plants. Gift a membership Senior Discount Individuals 65 and older are eligible to receive $10 off Individual, Dual, Family, and Family & Friends memberships. Certain restrictions apply. Cannot be combined with other discounts. Grandparents membership is ineligible for an additional senior discount. Discount is applied per membership, not per member. Student Discount Full-time college students between the ages of 18-24 are eligible to receive 50% off an Individual Membership. A valid student ID must be presented. Available for purchase in person only at The Shop. (Only available for Individual Memberships.) Teachers and Active Military Personnel Discount Active military personnel and full-time K-12 school teachers in Miami-Dade, Broward and Monroe counties may receive a 50% discount on Individual, Dual, Family and Family & Friends membership levels. A valid ID is required. Available for purchase in person only at The Shop. Contact Us For more information on membership at Fairchild, please contact Member Services at 305-667-1651, extension 3373. Please email any changes to your contact information to memberservices@fairchildgarden.org . Shop Plants & Tropical Fruit Garden Shop Rare Plant Auction Get Tickets Shop Plants & Tropical Fruit Rare Plant Auction Become a Member Get Tickets My Account Frequently Asked Questions TICKETS & ADMISSION MEMBERSHIP EVENTS EDUCATION TICKETS & ADMISSION What are the hours of operation? The Garden is open daily from 10:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. including all holidays except for December 25 th . Can my tickets be used on any day? Our general admission day tickets are open-ended and not date or time specific. You’re welcome to visit on any day or time. Can my admission tickets be used for daily special events? You may use your general admission tickets to enjoy events such as Jurassic Garden, Mango Days of Summer, Ramble, Chocolate and Orchid Festivals, plant sales, and holiday celebrations during regular Garden hours.  *Other fees may apply if there is a special activation within the event. Can I purchase my tickets in person? Our box office is open daily. You can purchase tickets in person if you prefer. Is there a charge for parking? Parking at the Garden is free of charge.  Please park at the Main Visitor Entrance.  The South Entrance is reserved for staff only. How long does it take to fully enjoy the Garden? The Garden is 83 acres with 2.1 miles of walking pavement.  In order to experience the entire Garden and exhibits, you will need about 2.5 hours. Can I take a tram tour? We offer free tram tours of the Garden on a first-come, first-serve basis. Tours are weather permitting. Schedules vary. Please check our tram tour schedule upon arrival. What activities are there for Children at the Garden? Fairchild is a great place to relax and spend the day in Miami with family and friends. Here at Fairchild,  encourage learning through fun, interactive, and truly hands-on experiences. You can get up close and personal with exotic butterflies, take an adventure through the Children’s Garden, Become an Explorer through our Expedition discovery Program and even walk through the only tropical rainforest in the continental US.  At Fairchild, there is always something for the whole family to enjoy. To learn more about family fun activities, CLICK HERE . What are the dining options available? The Glasshouse Café is open daily from 10:30a.m. – 4:00p.m. No reservations are required and indoor and outdoor seating is available.  The Glasshouse Café’s popular menu includes organic and locally grown food including soups, paninis, quiches, hand-crafted sodas, smoothies and desserts. CLICK HERE TO VIEW MENU The Shop at Fairchild has snacks and sundries available or if you prefer, you can bring food with you, however rolling coolers are not allowed. How should I prepare for my visit? Fairchild Tropical Botanic Garden is truly a unique place in Miami, and we’re so glad you’ve chosen to visit. CLICK HERE for a few tips to make your visit to Fairchild more memorable. Is the Garden accessible for individuals with disabilities? Fairchild is fully accessible for individuals with disabilities. Our pathways, exhibits and collections are accessible; many of our doors have automatic opening devices; our buildings have ADA -compliant restroom facilities; our trams accommodate wheelchairs and have assistive listening devices; we provide shuttle service for individuals needing additional assistance during their visit throughout the Garden; and much more. It is our intention to make Fairchild a fully enjoyable experience for all of our guests without exception. Who is eligible to receive a discount? Discounts (other than online promos) are applied in person on the day of your visit. You may be required to present an identification. If you have other discounts that you would like applied, please purchase your tickets in person. Military Discount Fairchild offers active military personnel and veterans free admission year-round. We also participate in the Blue Star Museums program, which offers free admission to families of active military personnel from Memorial Day through Labor Day. First Responders Discount Fairchild offers active first responders (active police and fire-rescue personnel) 50% off regular admission year-round. Please present your ID. AAA Discount Fairchild offers our AAA visitors a discount of $2 off regular adult admission. American Horticultural Society Reciprocal Admissions Program Fairchild is proud to participate in the American Horticultural Society Reciprocal Admissions Program . (Please note that there is an exclusion in reciprocity with other botanic gardens within 90 miles of Fairchild. We encourage you to contact participating organizations to determine eligibility.) Eco-Discount If you walk, ride your bike or take public transportation to Fairchild, receive $5 off the admission price for adults and $2 off the admission price for children. This promotion is good every day. It’s our way of thanking you for contributing to conservation. If you are a Fairchild Member and wish to ride your bike, walk or take public transportation, you will receive a Bike-N-Five loyalty card. After five visits, you will receive a gift admission valued at $25. Culture Shock Miami We participate in Culture Shock Miami , which offers discounted tickets to Fairchild for participating students between the ages 13-22. The Golden Ticket Program On the first Wednesday of each month, Miami-Dade County senior residents ages 62 and over with a Golden Ticket will receive one free admission to Fairchild. Please present your completed Golden Ticket form at the entrance. MEMBERSHIP Can I convert my admission to a membership? If you’ve enjoyed your visit to the Garden, we will happily apply the price of your admission toward a membership on the day of your visit. Any of our friendly admission personnel can assist you during your visit.  If you would like to speak to a Fairchild membership team member, please call 305-667-1651, extension 3373 or email memberservices@fairchildgarden.org . CLICK HERE to learn about becoming a member of Fairchild. Do members need to reserve tickets in advance? Members are not required to reserve tickets in advance. Please present your membership card or give your name at the entrance. When can members enter Fairchild early? Fairchild opens early for members each Tuesday at 7am. Members can check-in with security at the South Entrance Gate. I am a teacher, can I purchase my discounted membership online? Teachers K-12 must obtain their membership discount by phone or in person.If you would like to speak to a Fairchild membership team member, please call 305-667-1651, extension 3373 or email memberservices@fairchildgarden.org . I am a student, can I purchase my discounted membership online? Students must obtain their membership discount by phone or in person. Where is my Magazine? The Tropical Garden Magazine is currently on hold. Does Fairchild participate in the reciprocal members program? Individuals planning on visiting Fairchild with a reciprocal membership card from a participating organization 90 miles outside of Fairchild, please present the membership card upon arrival. Individuals within 90 miles of Fairchild may not be eligible. We encourage you to contact your participating member organization to determine eligibility. EVENTS Where can I find a calendar of events? To find a list of all of our upcoming events and classes, CLICK HERE Can my admission tickets be used for daily special events? You may use your general admission tickets to enjoy events such as Jurassic Garden, Mango Days of Summer, Ramble, Chocolate and Orchid Festivals, plant sales, and holiday celebrations during regular Garden hours.  *Other fees may apply if there is a special activation within the event. Who can I speak with about hosting an event at the Garden? If you have any event-related questions, please email specialevents@fairchildgarden.org . Can I have my wedding at Fairchild? Absolutely! The Fairchild team is committed to making your special day at Fairchild a dream come true. We have made it easy to plan your perfect Miami garden wedding. We have identified the most beautiful botanical garden wedding venues at Fairchild and curated packages and options to make your special day uniquely your own. CLICK HERE to learn more. If you would like to connect with a member of our wedding team, please email weddings@fairchildgarden.org and a team member will get back to you soon. Is there a fee to take video or photographs at Fairchild? Visitor Filming and Photography for Personal Use Visitors to Fairchild are encouraged to take photographs and shoot videos for personal use. Personal photographs and videos are not to be used for commercial purposes. Professional and Amateur Portraits and Filming for Personal Use Professional or amateur photographers taking photos for engagements, maternity, quinces and other life events must obtain a permit online or from the Information Desk in the Visitor Center. You will process your permit with payment the day you plan to film/take photos at the Visitor Center anytime during regular daytime operating hours (Monday-Sunday 10:00 a.m-4:00 p.m.), for more information regarding personal professional photography/filming please contact Rosemary Aquino 305-667-1651, ext. 3300. Professional Filming and Photography for Commercial Use Photographs and videos are not to be used for any commercial purposes without authorization. Professional photographers or filmmakers taking photos for promotional use must contact the Special Events Department in advance before filming or photography of any kind. The Special Events Department may be reached by contacting Lori Sellers lsellers@fairchildgarden.org at 305-667-1651 ext. 3558. Projects will be approved on a case-by-case basis, with Fairchild reserving the right to refuse any project. The Garden will not allow any implied or actual endorsement of a product, institution or ideology. Commercial filming and photography will occasion fees. EDUCATION Where can I find a list of upcoming classes? This season we have a dynamic balance of online and in-person classes that will offer techniques, demonstrations, and hands-on experiences. CLICK HERE for a full list of upcoming classes. Do I need to login to register for a class? No. Simply enter the quantity of the tickets you would like to purchase, and complete the registration form. The registration form enables us to contact you with supplies lists, syllabi, or any updates to the class. Then, you will be prompted to enter your payment information. After your payment has been confirmed, you will be automatically enrolled in the class and you will receive a confirmation email shortly thereafter. Can I register for a class in person, on the day of the event? We recommend reserving your spot through the website or over the phone in advance because we cannot always guarantee availability. Sometimes, we can accommodate one or two extra people in a sold-out class, but some classes have supply budgets and therefore a limited capacity. I have a question about classes. Who should I contact? Please send your question about classes to education@fairchildgarden.org . For adult and family classes, you may also leave a message at extension 3322. For summer camps, please leave a message at extension 3339. I have a question about a field trip. Who should I contact? Please send your question to education@fairchildgarden.org and an Fairchild education team member will get back to you soon. How do I get more information about the Growing Beyond Earth project? Growing Beyond Earth (GBE) is a classroom-based citizen science project operated in partnership with NASA. It includes a series of plant experiments conducted by students using equipment similar to the Vegetable Production System (Veggie) on the International Space Station. To find out how to get involved, read more here: https://fairchildgarden.org/gbe/ Can’t find what you are looking for? Send us a message! CLICK HERE , and use the drop down menu to find the department you would like to connect with and a Fairchild team member will get back to you soon. Thank you, and we look forward to your visit, Your Friends at Fairchild Get Tickets Tickets Membership Fairchild Hours & Admission Events APP Contact Contact Us Media Inquiries In the News Blog FAQ Location 10901 Old Cutler Road Miami, Florida 33156 Garden Map ▸

Shop Plants & Tropical Fruit Garden Shop Rare Plant Auction Get Tickets Shop Plants & Tropical Fruit Rare Plant Auction Become a Member Get Tickets My Account Visit We’re Glad You’re Visiting! Fairchild Tropical Botanic Garden is truly a unique place in Miami, and we’re so glad you’ve chosen to visit. Here you can walk garden paths surrounded by the wonders and beauty of nature, talk to experts in horticulture and conservation science, see butterflies and birds at every turn, experience our butterfly and hummingbird exhibit, Wings of the Tropics , and take classes on everything from photography to grafting. Walking the grounds will introduce you to a large variety of tropical plants and their amazing array of sizes, shapes and colors. The Garden includes many collections and exhibits as well as native habitats brought together in a unified landscape design that flows from one area to another. EARLY ACCESS FOR MEMBERS (Tuesdays only) Fairchild opens early for Members each Tuesday at 7:00 a.m. Members can check-in at the South Entrance Gate. Preparing for Your Visit Here are a few tips to make your visit to Fairchild more memorable. There is a lot to do during your visit; you should allow three hours or more if you plan to enjoy the entire Garden. Fairchild is in the tropics, you should dress comfortably. You can enjoy a free, narrated tram tour of the Garden. Protect yourself from the Miami sun; hats and sunscreen are encouraged. Consider bringing bug spray. Throughout the Garden, benches can be found for moments of rest and enjoyment. Stay hydrated. Bring your camera or use your smartphone to capture the wonderment of your experience. The Glasshouse Cafe offers uniquely tropical fare or, if you prefer, you can bring food with you. Our etiquette and general policies ensure that all of our guests have a memorable experience. Unmatched Visitor Service and Experience Your experience during your visit to Fairchild is our main priority. Our staff and volunteers are on-hand to ensure every minute of your visit is purely enjoyable. Guaranteed. Accessibility Fairchild is fully accessible for individuals with disabilities. Our pathways, exhibits and collections are accessible; many of our doors have automatic opening devices; our buildings have ADA -compliant restroom facilities; our trams accommodate wheelchairs and have assistive listening devices; we provide shuttle service for individuals needing additional assistance during their visit throughout the Garden; and much more. It is our intention to make Fairchild a fully enjoyable experience for all of our guests without exception. PLEASE NOTE: The Tram Tour schedule vary by day. Please check with our guest services associates in The Shop for the current times. We apologize for any inconvenience. To that end we: offer disabled parking at our various parking areas. During some events additional disabled parking is designated in the Lowlands Parking Field. have wheelchairs available for loan at no charge on a first-come, first-served basis at all of the entry points to the Garden. ensure accessibility to all of our exhibits. offer accessible paths to all of our buildings. ensure that our Trams accommodate individuals with disabilities. ensure that our Trams are equipped with assisted listening aids. offer accessible restrooms in every public building, including the Visitor Center, AP Arts Building, Corbin Education Building, Garden House, and Glasshouse Café. offer shuttle service to guests with disabilities. Shuttles provide transportation from one location to another within the Garden. Please inquire about shuttle service availability at entrance locations. PLEASE NOTE: The Tram Tour schedule vary by day. Please check with our guest services associates in The Shop for the current times. We apologize for any inconvenience. For additional information or any special requests, please contact shop@fairchildgarden.org or call 305-667-1651. Sustainability Fairchild supports conservation efforts throughout the world, locally and right here in the Garden. Our sustainability management practices include fully compostable materials in our restaurants, electric vehicles, low-water restroom facilities, a state-of-the-art resource-conscious irrigation system, LED lighting throughout, use of renewable building materials, a comprehensive recycling program, efficient and smart electronics throughout the Garden, LEED -level construction in all new buildings, natural pest maintenance, concrete pathways and much more. Staff - National Tropical Botanical Garden Browse Gardens Allerton Garden Kahanu Garden Limahuli Garden & Preserve McBryde Garden The Kampong Garden Book a Tour Donate Menu About Stories Events Science & Conservation Education Breadfruit Membership Staff Menu Allerton Garden Kahanu Garden Limahuli Garden & Preserve McBryde Garden The Kampong Garden Our Story Financial Information Job Opportunities Contact Staff News The Bulletin Strategic Plan Janet Mayfield – President and CEO Janet Mayfield is the President and Chief Executive Officer at National Tropical Botanical Garden (NTBG). Janet leads five geographically distinct botanical gardens whose combined mission is to enrich life by perpetuating tropical plants, ecosystems, and cultural heritage. Having lived on Kauaʻi for over 36 years, she has a deep appreciation for the community, the culture, and the environment. She was raised on a farm in Eastern Washington and recognizes the complexity of creating sustainable food sources and the challenges of maintaining environmentally responsible agriculture. Janet holds a BS in Accounting from Arizona State University and began her career with NTBG as Controller in 1997. From 2003-2018 she served as Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer. Janet assumed the role of Chief Executive Officer and Director in 2019 and successfully led the organization through the pandemic and helped to ensure a thriving, sustainable future for the organization. In addition to her role with NTBG, Janet has extensive experience in the management and finances of other non-profit organizations and continues to serve on community boards and advisory committees. Tami Rollins – Chief Financial Officer Tami is a CPA whose career has focused on accounting, finance, and taxes. She has a Bachelor of Business Administration from Florida Atlantic University and has lived and worked on Kauaʻi since 1987. Her experience ranges from working 20 years in public accounting with an emphasis on tax and non-profit audits and another 12 years working in the for-profit corporate world before joining the NTBG team in 2014 as the Controller. In 2019 she took over as CFO when Janet Mayfield became the CEO. Ms. Rollins also has served on many non-profit boards over the years. Dr. Tiffany Knight – Director of Science and Conservation As Director of Science and Conservation for the National Tropical Botanical Garden, Tiffany oversees the strategic development of science and conservation at the Juliet Rice Wichman Botanical Research Center (BRC) at NTBG’s headquarters on Kauaʻi. Tiffany came to NTBG in 2024 from a position as Professor and Head of Department of Species Interaction Ecology in Leipzig, Germany where she continues to have an affiliation. Following her PhD from the University of Pittsburgh, Tiffany held positions and adjunct appointments at the University of Florida, the National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis, Washington University in St. Louis, the Missouri Botanical Garden, and Chicago Botanic Garden. Tiffany is passionate about ecological research and new technologies that can be directly applied to conservation and restoration of plant biodiversity. Tobias Koehler – Director of South Shore Gardens (McBryde and Allerton) Tobias Koehler joined NTBG’s staff in February 2016 as director of its gardens on the South Shore of Kauaʻi. A member of NTBG’s senior management team, he is responsible for the activities within the McBryde and Allerton Gardens, including horticultural care and visitor program, as well as facilities upkeep for these gardens and NTBG’s adjacent headquarters campus. Mr. Koehler spent nearly a decade in the private sector as an environmental planner, project manager, and operations manager. In addition to his extensive experience in the for-profit world, he has a strong background in non-profit management as well as in marketing, business development, business process improvement, budgeting, financial management, resource management, and contracting. After completing an undergraduate degree in biology from the University of California at Berkeley and conducting botanical research in Panama and French Polynesia, Mr. Koehler relocated to Hawaiʻi and earned a Master’s degree in botany and one in business administration. Lei Wann – Director of Limahuli Garden & Preserve Since January 2020, Lei Wann has been the Director of Limahuli Garden and Preserve. Her ancestral ties to Limahuli and passion to care for Hā‘ena has created a deep connection that shines strongly in her leadership. She is able to share knowledge of the past while bringing in modern research. Lei Wann went to school at the University of Waikato, the University of Hawaiʻi at Hilo, and the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa with degrees in Anthropology, Pacific Island Studies, and Elementary Education. She began her career in conservation, then spent many years in education leading and developing aina based curriculum for keiki at Kawaikini NCPCS and Kamehameha Schools. Currently, she is carrying on her kuleana at Limahuli Garden and Preserve by teaching and perpetuating the biocultural traditions of Hā‘ena. Dr. Michael Opgenorth – Director of Kahanu Garden and Preserve Michael “Mike” Opgenorth has been the Director of NTBG’s Kahanu Garden and Preserve in Hāna, Maui, since 2015. Mike earned his undergraduate degree in Business Management with a minor in Plant Production/Plant Management from the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa. He later achieved his Ph.D. in Horticultural Science from the Natural History Museum of Denmark, University of Copenhagen. Mike’s research focuses on plants of the Pacific, particularly rare and culturally significant species. Using an interdisciplinary approach, his work investigates documentation of plant diversity, human relationships to plants, and their cultivation. Natalie King – Director of Philanthropy Natalie King joined NTBG as Director of Philanthropy in August 2024, leading our community of steadfast members, donors, funders, and volunteers. With over a dozen years of experience in philanthropy, Natalie holds an educational background in journalism, cultural anthropology, and museum studies. Growing up on Oʻahu, her deep connection to nature and community inspired her passion for biodiversity and biocultural conservation. Before joining NTBG, Natalie served as Senior Director of Individual Giving at Shedd Aquarium, where she played a pivotal role in advancing philanthropic efforts. She has also led philanthropic initiatives at the Girl Scouts of Greater Chicago and Northwest Indiana, the Smart Museum at the University of Chicago, and the Alpha Phi Foundation. David Bryant – Director of Communications David is passionate about bringing people and plants together. He served as the Director of Education & Engagement for the California Native Plant Society (CNPS) where he led public programs and campaigns to foster transformative change for people-plant relationships. He led statewide campaigns to build awareness and action for pivotal environmental issues in California, including wildfire, plant poaching, native plant horticulture, and Indigenous stewardship. Before CNPS, David served as the Director of Visitor Experience at California Botanic Garden. He led the implementation of the first interpretive master plan, oversaw a robust communications calendar, brought the retail nursery online, steered large-scale public events and led the rebranding of the organization. David is continually indebted to mentors from California and Baja California Native communities who have guided his commitment and passion for plant advocacy. David received his BFA from the Rhode Island School of Design and began his career with a formative internship at the Harvard Museum of Natural History, where he got to bring together his love of art and environmental communications. Dr. Brian Sidoti – Director of The Kampong Brian has nearly two decades of experience working at multiple botanical gardens and various museum settings. Most recently, he was at Fairchild Tropical Botanic Garden, where he co-led The Fairchild Challenge through program development, fundraising and marketing. He previously taught at State College of Florida, Manatee-Sarasota and co-led its Biotechnology Outreach Program. Brian received his Ph.D. in Botany from the University of Wisconsin- Madison, where he studied the evolutionary history and conservation genetics of the Caribbean Basin cardinal airplant. Brian also has his M.S. in Biology through Florida International University and Fairchild’s graduate program. As an FIU alumnus, he is excited by the collaborative opportunities between The Kampong and the International Center for Tropical Botany. Brian volunteered in The Peace Corps in Nicaragua as a Community Environment Promoter after receiving his B.A. in Biology at Colby College. As Director, he is thrilled to provide leadership and direction to The Kampong – a living botanical garden and museum. He is excited to lead the team in connecting people to plants through enriching experiences focused on discovery, education, horticulture and scientific research. Federal Tax ID: 52-6057064 DIACRITICALS National Tropical Botanical Garden is headquartered on the island of Kauai in Hawaii and recognizes the use of diacritical markings of the modern Hawaiian language including the ʻokina [ ʻ ] or glottal stop and the kahakō [ō] or macron. However, we have omitted these markings throughout our website to ensure the best online experience for our local, national and international users. Per our mission, NTBG is committed to perpetuating the survival of cultural knowledge and recognizes the importance of using these markings to preserve the language and culture of Hawaii. We respectfully use diacriticals in all of our printed communication beyond the online platform. COPYRIGHT 2019 NATIONAL TROPICAL BOTANICAL GARDEN. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
